title: Abundant Rainfall
description: In 2021, Colombia experienced an average precipitation depth of 3,240 mm per year, making it one of the wettest countries globally.

title: Strong Financial Asset Growth
description: By 2023, Colombia's net acquisition of financial assets reached 51,183,608,734,308 LCU, showcasing robust financial growth.

title: High Net Financial Liabilities
description: In 2023, Colombia's net incurrence of liabilities totaled 84,350,241,177,929.6 LCU, indicating significant financial obligations.

title: Significant Tax Revenue from Goods and Services
description: Colombia collected 119,161,332,024,101 LCU in taxes on goods and services in 2023, reflecting a strong tax base.

title: High Interest Payments
description: Interest payments in Colombia amounted to 69,633,047,516,322.6 LCU in 2023, highlighting a considerable financial burden.

title: Quality Business Entry Regulations
description: In 2024, Colombia scored 96.6 in the Business Entry Pillar, indicating high-quality regulations for business entry.

title: Effective Dispute Resolution Services
description: Colombia achieved a score of 80.05 in the Dispute Resolution Pillar in 2024, reflecting efficient public services for dispute resolution.

title: High Child Employment in Manufacturing
description: In 2015, 15.23% of economically active children aged 7-14 were employed in manufacturing, indicating a challenge in child labor.

title: High Demand for Family Planning Met
description: In 2015, 86.4% of married women in Colombia had their demand for family planning satisfied by modern methods, showcasing effective family planning services.

title: High Number of Surgical Procedures
description: Colombia performed 27,385 surgical procedures per 100,000 population in 2015, indicating a well-equipped healthcare system.

title: Limited Investment in Nonfinancial Assets
description: In 2016, Colombia reported a net investment in nonfinancial assets of -4,257,815,123,537 LCU, indicating a significant reduction in investment activities.

title: Negative Changes in Inventories
description: As of 2023, Colombia experienced a decrease in inventories amounting to -59,417,000,000,000 LCU, reflecting a contraction in stock levels.

title: Low Coverage of Unemployment Benefits
description: In 2022, only 14.57% of Colombia's population was covered by unemployment benefits and active labor market programs, highlighting limited social protection.

title: Minimal Social Safety Net Adequacy
description: The adequacy of social safety net programs in Colombia was 69.11% of the total welfare of beneficiary households in 2022, indicating room for improvement.

title: Low Acceptance of Domestic Violence
description: In 2015, only 3.1% of Colombian women believed a husband is justified in beating his wife for any reason, reflecting progressive attitudes towards domestic violence.
